justification: "Learning of motor skills with sequentially structured patterns has been well-studied using the Serial Reaction Time Task (SRTT)" – indicating that the construct of motor sequence learning is operationalised with the SRTT.
"Experiment 1 was designed for testing ... whether participants' reaction time (RT) improved ... indicating that RT change is the metric used to assess motor sequence learning."
"We tested if an intra-individual variability on RT, measured by a mean coefficient of variance (CV), changed across repetitions of training among conditions."
"As a measure of choice distribution, we used entropy sum (as bits) ... p(x) as a proportion of each choice over total events per block."
